about.summary: Provides the 'Molecular Signatures Database' (MSigDB) gene sets typically used with the 'Gene Set Enrichment Analysis' (GSEA) software (Subramanian et al. 2005 <doi:10.1073/pnas.0506580102>, Liberzon et al. 2015 <doi:10.1016/j.cels.2015.12.004>) in a standard R data frame with key-value pairs. Included are the original human gene symbols and Entrez IDs as well as the equivalents for various frequently studied model organisms such as mouse, rat, pig, fly, and yeast.

Provides the 'Molecular Signatures Database' (MSigDB) gene sets typically used with the 'Gene Set Enrichment Analysis' (GSEA) software (Subramanian et al. 2005 <doi:10.1073/pnas.0506580102>, Liberzon et al. 2015 <doi:10.1016/j.cels.2015.12.004>) in a standard R data frame with key-value pairs. Included are the original human gene symbols and Entrez IDs as well as the equivalents for various frequently studied model organisms such as mouse, rat, pig, fly, and yeast.

name: r-msigdbr
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "25.1.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-msigdbr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/msigdbr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/msigdbr/msigdbr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 2695929da0226b8ad01a6dd27eea70673c4673c7cff21e7600764dd8e7fdd002

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-assertthat
    - r-babelgene >=22.9
    - r-curl
    - r-dplyr >=1.1.1
    - r-lifecycle
    - r-rlang
    - r-tibble
    - r-tidyselect >=1.2.0
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-assertthat
    - r-babelgene >=22.9
    - r-curl
    - r-dplyr >=1.1.1
    - r-lifecycle
    - r-rlang
    - r-tibble
    - r-tidyselect >=1.2.0

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('msigdbr')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('msigdbr')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/igordot/msigdbr
  license: MIT
  summary: Provides the 'Molecular Signatures Database' (MSigDB) gene sets typically used with the 'Gene Set Enrichment Analysis' (GSEA) software (Subramanian et al. 2005 <doi:10.1073/pnas.0506580102>, Liberzon et al. 2015 <doi:10.1016/j.cels.2015.12.004>) in a standard R data frame with key-value pairs. Included are the
    original human gene symbols and Entrez IDs as well as the equivalents for various frequently studied model organisms such as mouse, rat, pig, fly, and yeast.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: msigdbr
# Type: Package
# Title: MSigDB Gene Sets for Multiple Organisms in a Tidy Data Format
# Version: 6.2.1
# Authors@R: person("Igor", "Dolgalev", email = "igor.dolgalev@nyumc.org", role = c("aut", "cre"))
# Description: Provides the 'Molecular Signatures Database' (MSigDB) gene sets typically used with the 'Gene Set Enrichment Analysis' (GSEA) software (Subramanian et al. 2005 <doi:10.1073/pnas.0506580102>, Liberzon et al. 2015 <doi:10.1016/j.cels.2015.12.004>) in a standard R data frame with key-value pairs. Included are the original human gene symbols and Entrez IDs as well as the equivalents for various frequently studied model organisms such as mouse, rat, pig, fly, and yeast.
# License: MIT + file LICENSE
# Encoding: UTF-8
# URL: https://github.com/igordot/msigdbr

# LazyData: true
